alert.note: Alert for Kohala; Kona (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued January 25 at 3:34PM HST until January 26 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH 6 PM HST THURSDAY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI AND FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .An extra large northwest (300-320 degree) swell will continue to move through the island chain tonight and slowly subside Thursday producing extremely dangerous surf and overwash conditions along many north and west facing shorelines. ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously large breaking waves building to 8 to 12 feet. * WHERE...West facing shores of Kona and Kohala on the Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Thursday. * IMPACTS...High. Expect very strong breaking waves and powerful currents. Waves breaking in channel entrances may make navigating the channels dangerous.
info.instruction: Stay away from the shoreline along the affected coasts. Be prepared for road closures. Postpone entering or leaving channels affected by the high surf until the surf subsides.
